page.title: 19The Caring Community.
page.content: In Rode a doctor's surgery is held in the Memorial Hall, every Wednesday morning and a child welfare clinic monthly. At other times, patients must visit the main surgery at Beckington, where there is a dispensary. Meals on wheels, i.e. hot lunches, are delivered to the homes of the sick and elderly by the Women's Voluntary Service. The British Legion drive people to visit hospital patients. In Southwick there is no surgery, the nearest being at Trowbridge. However, there is a free delivery service of medicines, by a Trowbridge chemist, to people aged over sixty. A child welfare clinic is held twice monthly in Southwick's village hall. There is a district nurse and home help service for those who require them in both Rode and Southwick.
